org.streaminer.stream.quantile

Class GKQuantiles

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.streaminer.stream.quantile.GKQuantiles
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IQuantiles<Double>

    public class GKQuantiles
extends Object
implements IQuantiles<Double>
    This class is an implementation of the Greenwald-Khanna algorithm for computing epsilon-approximate quantiles of large data sets. In its pure form it is an offline algorithm. But it is used as a black box by many online algorithms for computing epsilon-approximate quantiles on data streams.
    Our implementation widely adapts the original idea published by Michael Greenwald and Sanjeev Khanna in their paper "Space-Efficient Online Computation of Quantile Summaries". Contrary to their idea this implementation uses a list rather than a tree structure to maintain the elements.
    Author:
    Markus Kokott, Carsten Przyluczky

      • getQuantile

        public Double getQuantile(double q)
        Estimates appropriate quantiles (i.e. values that holds epsilon accuracy). Note that if the query parameter doesn't lay in [0,1] Double.NaN is returned! The same result will be returned if an empty instance of GK is queried.
        Specified by:
        getQuantile in interface IQuantiles<Double>
        Parameters:
        q - a float value
        Returns:
        an estimated quantile represented by a Double. Will return Double.NaN if phi isn't between 0 and 1 or this instance of GKQuantiles is empty.
